title: Justification - Average Value of a Function

content.description: Tara’s heart rate during a workout is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="h of t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is measured in beats per minute and <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes from the start of the workout.
content.question: Which of the following expressions gives Tara’s average heart rate from <math alttext="t equals 30" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="t equals 60" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>60</mn> </mrow> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 30 to 60, of, h of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 30, end fraction, times the integral from, 30 to 60, of, h of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over 30, end fraction, times the integral from, 30 to 60, of, h prime of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator h prime of 30, plus h prime of 60, and denominator, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over 30, end fraction, times the integral from, 30 to 60, of, h of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
